p: About 6–8 weeks-old male BALB/c mice (16–18g) received an intraperitoneal injection of 1500 TCID 50 (1050 pfu) dose of CVB3. The body weight and survival of mice were measured at the end of the test. After 3 and 7 days following infection, heart tissues were obtained for the detection of histology analysis, virus RNA and cytokines. The details of histology tests are as described before [ 17]. Severity of myocarditis was evaluated from five sections per heart by using a 1 to 5 scoring system: grade 0, no inflammation; grade 1, less than 10% of the heart section is involved; grade 2, 10–30%; grade 3, 30–50%; grade 4, 50–90%; grade 3, more than 90%. To evaluate the effect of LiCl on viral myocarditis, each mouse was infected intraperitoneally with CVB3 after which they were divided into two groups (8–10 mice/group), PBS and LiCl treatments. Considering the effective dose of LiCl in cells (10–50 mM), the fraction of drug absorbance through i.p. approximately 60% and the bodyweight of the mice, LiCl (100 μL, 50 mM/per mouse) were daily applied to mice i.p. upon infection.
